csw.services.alarms

Interface AlarmServiceAdmin

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AlarmServiceAdminImpl

    public interface AlarmServiceAdmin
    Defines the admin API for Alarm Service

    • Method Detail

      • initAlarms

        scala.concurrent.Future<scala.collection.immutable.List<AscfValidation.Problem>> initAlarms(java.io.File inputFile,
                                                                                            boolean reset)
        Initialize the alarm data in the database using the given file

        Parameters:
        inputFile - the alarm service config file containing info about all the alarms
        reset - if true, delete the current alarms before importing (default: false)
        Returns:
        a future list of problems that occurred while validating the config file or ingesting the data into the database

      • refreshSecs

        int refreshSecs()
        Alarm severity should be reset every refreshSecs seconds to avoid being expired (after three missed refreshes)
        Returns:
        (undocumented)

      • getAlarms

        scala.concurrent.Future<scala.collection.Seq<AlarmModel>> getAlarms(AlarmKey alarmKey)
        Gets the alarm information from the database for any matching alarms

        Parameters:
        alarmKey - a key that may match multiple alarms (via wildcards, see AlarmKey.apply())
        Returns:
        a future sequence of alarm model objects

      • getHealth

        scala.concurrent.Future<AlarmModel.Health> getHealth(AlarmKey alarmKey)
        Gets the health of the system, subsystem or component, based on the given alarm key.

        Parameters:
        alarmKey - an AlarmKey matching the set of alarms for a component, subsystem or all subsystems, etc. (Note that each of the AlarmKey fields may be specified as None, which is then converted to a wildcard "*")
        Returns:
        the future health value (good, ill, bad)

      • monitorAlarms

        AlarmService.AlarmMonitor monitorAlarms(AlarmKey alarmKey,
                                        akka.actor.ActorRef subscriber,
                                        boolean notifyAll)
        Starts monitoring the health of the system, subsystem or component

        Parameters:
        alarmKey - an AlarmKey matching the set of alarms for a component, subsystem or all subsystems, etc. (Note that each of the AlarmKey fields may be specified as None, which is then converted to a wildcard "*")
        subscriber - an actor that will receive a HealthStatus message whenever the health for the given key changes
        notifyAll - if true, all severity changes are reported (for example, for logging), otherwise only the relevant changes in alarms are reported, for alarms that are not shelved and not out of service, and where the latched severity or calculated health actually changed
        Returns:
        an object containing the actorRef for the subscriber actor (kill the actor to stop monitoring)

      • monitorAlarms

        AlarmService.AlarmMonitor monitorAlarms(AlarmKey alarmKey,
                                        scala.Function1<AlarmModel.AlarmStatus,scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> notifyAlarm,
                                        scala.Function1<AlarmModel.HealthStatus,scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> notifyHealth,
                                        boolean notifyAll)
        Starts monitoring the health of the system, subsystem or component

        Parameters:
        alarmKey - an AlarmKey matching the set of alarms for a component, subsystem or all subsystems, etc. (Note that each of the AlarmKey fields may be specified as None, which is then converted to a wildcard "*")
        notifyAlarm - a function that will be called with an AlarmStatus object whenever the severity of an alarm changes
        notifyHealth - a function that will be called with a HealthStatus object whenever the total health for key pattern changes
        notifyAll - if true, all severity changes are reported (for example, for logging), otherwise only the relevant changes in alarms are reported, for alarms that are not shelved and not out of service, and where the latched severity or calculated health actually changed
        Returns:
        an object containing the actorRef for the subscriber actor (kill the actor to stop monitoring)

      • shutdown

        scala.concurrent.Future<scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> shutdown()
        Shuts down the the database server (For use in test cases that started the database themselves)
        Returns:
        (undocumented)
